p: On the other hand, IBV are divided into two major lineages that are co-circulating in the human population: the Victoria- and Yamagata-like lineages [ 21, 25]. These two lineages diverged in the 1980s from the ancestral influenza B/Lee/40. Although perceived as less dangerous than IAV, IBV infections cause annual outbreaks of respiratory illness and are associated with excess morbidity and mortality in the pediatric population [ 26, 27]. Typically, IBV epidemics are less severe than H3N2 IAV but more severe than H1N1 IAV in adults and the elderly population [ 28, 29, 30].
